title: 4 Simple Ways to Check Your Google Play Account Balance

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone. The Google Play Store is the app with the multi-colored 'play' triangle. [1] X Research source If needed, you can download Google Play . You can use Google Play to download free apps on Android .

steps.title: Tap your profile icon at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon at the top-right corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Payments & subscriptions > Payment methods.
steps.content: Tap Payments & subscriptions > Payment methods . A new page will open.

steps.title: Locate your balance.
steps.content: Locate your balance. You can find your Play Balance at the top of the page underneath Payment methods . If you don't see a balance, this means your balance is empty.

steps.title: Go to https://play.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://play.google.com in a web browser. You can use a mobile or desktop browser on any computer to check your Google Play balance. If you aren't logged in automatically, click Sign In in the top-right corner and log in with the email address and password for your Google account. You can always log off later.

steps.title: Click your profile icon in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click your profile icon in the top-right corner. This will be next to the magnifying glass and question mark icon. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Payments & subscriptions.
steps.content: Click Payments & subscriptions . A new window will open with your Payment methods , Subscriptions , and Budget & order history .

steps.title: Locate your balance.
steps.content: Locate your balance. You can find your Play Balance at the top of the page in the "Payment Methods" section. If you don't see a balance, this means your balance is empty. You can always purchase another Google Play gift card to reload your account, or you can add an alternate payment method. Don't confuse your "Google Play" balance with your "Google Pay" balance. Google Play can only be used to purchase things from the Google Play Store, such as apps, movies, music, etc., while Google Pay can be used to make any purchase anywhere that accepts Google Pay.

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone. The Google Play Store is the app with the multi-colored 'play' triangle. [2] X Research source To check the balance of a Google Play gift card, you must redeem the card with your Google Play account.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon at the top-right corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Payments & subscriptions > Redeem gift code.
steps.content: Tap Payments & subscriptions > Redeem gift code . You can find this towards the bottom of the page, above Buy Google Play Credit .

steps.title: Enter the gift card code and tap Redeem.
steps.content: Enter the gift card code and tap Redeem . Any existing balance will be transferred to your Google Play account. If you want to simply check the gift card balance but don't want to redeem the card, cancel the process once Google tells you how much you're about to redeem. If you continue at this point, you will redeem the card. Follow the steps from Using Android to see your new balance.

steps.title: Go to [3] X Research source in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to [3] X Research source in a web browser. You can use a mobile or desktop browser. To check the balance of a Google Play gift card, you must redeem the card with your Google Play account. If you aren't already logged in, click Sign in to do so now.

steps.title: Enter your gift card code and click Redeem.
steps.content: Enter your gift card code and click Redeem . Use the pop-up window to input your code. Any existing balance will be transferred to your Google Play account. If you want to simply check the gift card balance but don't want to redeem the card, cancel the process once Google tells you how much you're about to redeem. If you continue at this point, you will redeem the card. Follow the steps from Using a PC, Mac, or Chromebook to see your new balance.

steps.title: Can I check my Google Play gift card balance without redeeming it?
steps.content: Can I check my Google Play gift card balance without redeeming it? Unfortunately, no. You can go through the redemption process right up until the point you finalize the redemption, at which point Google will tell you how much you're redeeming to your Google Play balance. You can cancel the redemption at this point. Otherwise, if the gift card is digital, check the email where you got the gift card code to see if the balance is listed. If the gift card is physical, the balance should be listed somewhere on the card or on the receipt for the card. If you see any links or numbers to check your Google Play gift card balance, avoid them. They don't work.

steps.title: What can I use my Google Play balance for?
steps.content: What can I use my Google Play balance for? You can use your Google Play balance to purchase premium apps, music, books, and movies from the Google Play Store. You can also use it to pay for in-app purchases such as power-ups in games or subscriptions (like for YouTube Premium or Google Music).
